content.c_description:
Misinformation isn't just a consumer problem. It's a business problem around the world — and that includes the Japanese town of Ōkuma, Fukushima, Japan.

In 2011, Ōkuma experienced a category 9.1 earthquake, triggering a tsunami that left devastating destruction in its wake. It also caused core meltdowns at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plants, tainting the water and land with radioactivity that has since cleared out.

While Fukushima’s water and soil is now ironically safer than that of other major Japanese cities, Ōkuma still bears a seemingly permanent stigma of the meltdown. Farmers and food distributors are suffering as a result, their profits and the region’s economy taking a nosedive.

Yext’s CEO Howard Lerman decided to visit Ōkuma to debunk the misinformation and deliver the truth online.

Learn more about Yext: https://yex.tt/3bHtA7I
content.yext/name: Yext Explores Misinformation Behind Fukushima Water Safety
